title: Poland’s Ruling Nationalists Eye New Term as Voting Begins
text:
WARSAW—Voters in Poland went to the polls Sunday for a general election in which one of Europe’s most conservative ruling parties is expected to carry the largest share of votes on a nationalist platform that has pitted it against the European Union.

The nationalist Law and Justice party has built a double-digit lead in opinion polls, campaigning on a platform that pairs generous welfare spending with heated rhetoric against immigration and gay rights. It is also fighting a running battle with the EU, which it accuses of spreading...
description: Voters in Poland went to the polls for a general election in which one of Europe’s most conservative ruling parties is expected to carry the largest share of votes on a nationalist platform that has pitted it against the European Union.
